snippet: Cases of cyclists killing pedestrians are increasing in San Francisco, a cycling-friendly city.
abstract: Decision by George Gascon, San Francisco's district attorney, to charge Chris Bucchere with felony vehicular manslaughter after 71-year-old woman Sutchi Hui died after being struck by Bucchere's bicycle has set the city on edge; cases of cyclists killing pedestrians are increasing in San Francisco, a city that has embraced cycling, and the case has amplified existing ire between cyclists and other road and sidewalk users.
lead_paragraph: Cases of cyclists killing pedestrians are increasing in San Francisco, a cycling-friendly city.

headline.seo: San Francisco Cyclist Charged With Manslaughter
headline.main: After Death, Manslaughter Charge for Cyclist
headline.print_headline: After Death, Manslaughter Charge for Cyclist
